content: The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2006, also known as the Clayton Act, prohibits injunctive relief suits against railroad common carriers not under the jurisdiction of the Surface Transportation Board. It also addresses mergers and acquisitions of railroads. The Clayton Act exempts certain railroad mergers and acquisitions from its provisions if authorized by specific government agencies like the Secretary of Transportation or the Securities and Exchange Commission.
